column2: STBOURQUE, 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I WAS ON 10 MG BUT LOWERED MY THE ACTIVITY OF MY THYROID TOO MUCH. NOW TAKING 5MG ONCE A DAY

column2: Simba, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for nine months with few side effects; at the initial period I experienced some nausea and vomiting, which has subsided. My bowel movements returned to normal (previously, occasional diarrhea) and I began to regain some weight. Overall, this is a good way to judge weather surgery is necessary. Between taking this medication twice a day or the operating room, recovery and scarring, the pill was a no-brainer! Thank you for your enthusiasm and I hope you become well again, soon. You should see total results within a few weeks. Good Health, Simba

column2: angiw, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I found out in mid-March that I have Graves Disease and started taking Tapazole for it. The first subscription was for a generic or something, it tasted so bitter I could not take it but my doctor gave me the tapazole and the taste was much better. Reading through these reviews, I am so thankful for the lack of symptoms. I had the swollen neck, racing heart, labored breathing, buggy eyes and some irritability but no night sweats, depression, etc. The good news is that before meds my T3/T4  was 20/5 and after a month at 30mg, my T4 was actually low - meaning the medicine was very effective. The bad news is almost 20lbs in weight gain. Obviously, I am thankful I am not dying or have PK like I feared but having had gastric bypass surgery 10 yrs ago and being very careful with my weight, this weight gain is depressing me. There is no substitute for my health but is there a natural remedy for reversing the weight gain side effect of this med???

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Tapazol by a endoctronologist, Dr. Larry Cantley, in WS, NC. Bottom line, I almost died from this drug. I developed drug induced hepatitis & was told by this doctor " not to be concerned...my body was adapting to the RX". In the meantime, my urine was turning almost black, i itched horribly...even behind my eyelids. It became difficult to hold my head up, I was so weak. In addition, I became jaundiced. Had it not been for my pharmacist, I am certain I would have died from this med. He immediately recognized my symptoms as severe side effects from this medication. What I was experiencing had nothing to do with whatever condition I was being treated for. It took me 6 weeks to recover after ceasing this medication. It also turned out that I NEVER had hyperthroidism in the first place! Be extremely cautious before taking this, or any med. And, always get a second opinion...even if a "reputable" specialist makes a diagnosis.

column2: Don, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Diagnozed with Graves disease 7 months ago. Heart racing, weight loss, blurred vision, extreme fatique, sleeping 2 hours a day. Take 3 5 mg every morning for first few months. Everything got better but tired around 11 am. Take it at night now and sleep 6 to 8 hours every night. Starting to get real tired during the day, fall asleep while standing in line at checkout. Think the MD has to start cutting me back on meds. I would much rather stay on Tapazole for my whole life than to get surgery or RAI. I think it except for the hairloss.

column2: Angela56, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Initially, I had severe diarrhoea and nausea with tapazole but these cleared 2 weeks after commencement of treatment. My T4 values which were > 100 fell to 30 within 1 month of using this medication. Overall in combination with propranolol, tapazole remains my drug of choice for my overactive thyroid

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started to take this medicine three months ago and I am so tired and gained 12 pounds, which I am very upset about. Otherwise no other side effects. The cure woese than the disease? In my case; yes.

column2: ellen, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started 30 mg day, then up to 40 mg day. It's been 5-6 months. No side effects of note. Feel more relaxed, gained moderate amt of weight. Last blood test Dr told me to stop totally for 2 weeks, then begin 20 mg day. I was feeling tired, achy, distant. Probably should have reduced it earlier. I haven't taken any for 4 days. Still tired and feeling 'distant' but overall I believe it's been a good experience thus far.

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I am a long term user of Tapazole for Grave's Disease for over a decade now.  In low maintenance dosages, 2.5 to 10mg risks of serious side effects are very low.  Treatment is inexpensive compared to surgery or RAI, and you don't have to take weeks off from work.  If you are not allergic to it, there's no science backed reason you can't keep taking Tapazole every time you relapse. finding the right doc though...that can be harder.

column2: r12ose, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am taking 40mgs daily. Two 10mg tabs twice daily. This dose may be too strong b/c I have nausea, stomach pain, some vomiting and a major 2 day headache (i am not prone to these). I have only been on this med for 3 days.

column2: none ya, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had severalbad sideaffects from taking this medication. I would not advise taking this due to all the issues I have had.

column2: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: How long can I take this medication?

column2: New patient, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've started Tapazole for one month now at 10mg/day.  No side effect at this time.  The medicine works wonderfully, no more trumors and I have more energy.  Thanks goodness.

column2: Angela, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I didn't realize at first I had a problem with my thyroid because I assumed the symptoms were caused by recent surgery for cancer of the pancreas and I am also diabetic.  Once I went on the medication I realized most of my problems were caused by toxic goiter nodule of the thyroid. I am also assuming this came about from many Ct Scans before and after surgery.

column2: Anti-TAPAZOLE, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This occured years ago, but it did happen:  After taking Tapazole for only 2 to 2 1/2 months, I ended up in the hospital in isolation with no white blood cells, low red cells, failure/breakdown of immune system including bone marrow failure.  My doctor specializing in hemotology only gave me 5% chance of recovery.  After 15 days, I finally was able to go home, but my recovery was considered a miracle.  Be very alert if you take this and insist on frequent/at least weekly blood tests to watch for severe reactions.  They don't happen very often, BUT THEY DO HAPPEN.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
John, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: No side effects noticed.Seem to tolerate drug well.Do seem to be more fatiqued than usual,but otherwise fine.

column2: Joan, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking this for 1 month with Lopressor (for the racing heart part). My doctor said it could take 6 months to work and I am just starting to get my energy back since he raised the dosage. I no longer have the edema either. I do still have the "sweats".My doctor has done several tests including eyes and heart because thyroid effects those too. I check up with the endrocrinologist my doctor has been working with next month.I am thankful for this medicine because any side effects are better than Graves Disease symptoms.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Began taking 10 mg 1 month ago, after 1 year of being tired. Had never lost weight before, but all of a sudden I have gained 10 lbs, in a month. Slightly less tired now, still have tremors & heart palpitations. I am very upset about the weight gain. Extremely noticeable in tummy area.

column2: shanana, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: it makes me lightheaded

column2: Joann  Navarro, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I believe my Doctor has started me on too low a dose(5mg)

column2: little one, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: started taking it 4 weeks ago. gained 7lbs in 4 days, got sore throat, and 3am night sweats so bad I needed a shower. After weight gain dropped to 1 pill a day. Then the night sweats and sore throat together. Stopped taking pill and everything disappeared. Dr. says no relation to meds.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Tapazole for 4 months.  It has worked well to drop my thyroid hormone levels.  My doctor and I are still trying to find the right maintenance dose.  I started at 30mg/day and am now at 7.5mg/day.  After 3 months I experienced abnormal hair loss.  I've lost about 30% of my hair and continue to loose.  Hopefully the hair loss will subside.  Overall the benefits of this medication out way the hair loss side effect.

column1: Symptoms arising in Severe Thyrotoxicosis Thyroid Crisis
column2: roxy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: beside not working, I never slept a wink as long as I took the tapazol and I had a allergic reaction, the first in my life.

column2: Cruisegirl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was recently diagnosed with Graves disease. Before my diagnosis, my endocrinologist was not sure that I had a thyroid problem due to lack of symptoms.  The only noticeable symptom I had was loss of weight. A thyroid scan and further TSH test revealed that I have an overactive thyroid.  I have been on Methimazole (10 mg) a day for a month.I am grateful that have not experienced any side effects.

column2: Too, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Took my first pill yesterday around 5 pm. Woke up at 10:30 with severe stomach pain. Now I am afraid to take a dose today. Will call doctor.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I hate that they gave me the 5mg pills to take instead of the 10mg.  The 5mg are so small and uncoated that they get stuck in my throat every time I take them.  That is my only complaint.

column2: anon, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking 10mg of Tapazole daily for six months to treat Graves disease. I have gained 35 pounds--what I'd lost and some extra. My heart palpitations have stopped and most of the tremors. Also improved depression symptoms, decreased bowel movements, and cleared up my skin problems.I was feeling better, but the last four weeks, I've noticed increasing muscle weakness and hair loss. At least 50% of my hair has come out. Last time I had blood work done (March), the thyroid levels were "getting better." I'm going to ask about my side effects and potentially adjusting my medication dosage when the office re-opens after the holiday.The first two weeks I took the medication I had nausea about an hour after taking it. The taste of the pill is awful. It also makes me very sleepy, so I take it at night.

column2: liliji, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only been on methimazole for a week (for Grave's disease) but about 12 hours after starting it I got severe abdominal cramps which I've had now for 6 days, and which are incapacitating (and I've been unable to eat during this time as well). I've been to several doctors and the emergency room and no one knows what's causing it. Since I've never had this before and it started the morning after I first took methimazole the night before, I'm wondering if this is the problem and I should switch to another medication.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: severe arthridic pain while taking medication

column2: sandy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: just getting started on this  not sure how to tell if its working  i still get tired and could sleep at the drop of a dime   and cont to lose weight even though i eat several times a day

column2: cineofmine, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have what is known as symtomactic hyperthroid. I saw my endo. doctor and he said it showed on a 6000.00 med bill that one side of the thyroid was not as big as the other. A touch smaller . I have not lost weight but gained. I am losing hair. and the after taste is awful. Not sure if the risks outweigh what might occcur in the future. I am prone to ostoprosis, and the md. said also heart desease. So what does one do? One md said take it out the other nothing and the 3rd doctor said take this pill 1 time a day 5mg. I am so not sure.

column2: hcc, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: started itching terribly with large welts after 3 weeks on 40 mg. per day.  stopped taking it and needed antihistamines desperately and still itching after 5 days.  now my joints are very painful and I don't know what is happening!!

column2: SMP, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been on this drug now for about 2 months, and my major complaint is the taste I have in my mouth even hours after taking it.  I usually take it after I eat.  I pinch off a piece of bread, squeeze the pill inside and literally throw it down my throat, chasing it with water. Hours later, I have this horrible taste in my mouth....like I've had galvanized nails in my mouth.  Has this been a problem with anyone...and any solution???  There are no other side effects....althought I think my immune system is down...I've gotten the stomach flu and a severe sore throat during these last 2 months.....

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was on this medication for about 1 month.  The doctor that prescribed it was an endocrinologist and we trusted his specialty in this area.  But within a month it had wiped my white blood cell count out.  I ended up hospitalized for 7 days on strong antibiotics for infections.  I know it works for lots of people but make sure your doctor keep a close check especially when you first take the medicine.

column2: none, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: It has helped me for a while, but I'm still feeling tired, just like I did before,I was diagnosed with Autoimmune Graves disease

column2: Mickee, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: It,s been a wonder drug for me.  I quit losing weight, my heart rate is back down to normal, my hair is growing back in ect.  I shook so bad I thought I had Parkinsons. No side effects for me. My chronic depression disappeared also.

column2: dbs910, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started with 20 mgs daily and have been reduced now alternating 5 one day and 2.5 the next.  No heart palps and much better sleeping.  I have been on this med for 9 months.

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been on the medication 6weeks. I don't notice much improvement yet but my doctor said it takes at least 10 weeks. Side effects are nausea, and swelling/tearing of the eyes. I am on 10mg daily. Does make me feel sleepy so I take it at night.

column2: Chris, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Tapazole about 2 years now. The benefits of it have outweighed the side effects. I get a little drowsy from it sometimes, but before I started on it, I thought I was going to die of a heart attack! My heart pounded all the time, and I had trouble breathing sometimes. My legs swelled and ached so bad, and my back kept going out to the point where I could not walk for over a week. Since I've been on it, none of that has happened!

column2: ROSE, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: IAM CONFUSED AS TO WHAT I HAVE... FIRST WHEN I WAS DIAGNOSED MY THYROID WAS LOW NOW DOCTORS SAYS ITS HIGH OR OVER ACTIVE...IAM STILL GAINING WEIGHT AND FEEL TIRED ALL THE TIME, NOW I MIGHT HAVE SOME KIND OF ANEMIA. DONT KNOW WERE TO TURN. CONFUSED! somewhat happy with meds.

column2: leilani40, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication has help me alot it stop my body cramp my vision has improved so much it makes my body work so much different then before i knew what i had now i understanding the disease and knowing that  it so importance to take your medication everyday as directed by your doctor.

column2: queenfish1977, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for a little over a year, doctor is still trying to get dosage correct for me, now up to 20 mg a day seems to have helped with rapid heart rate and shaking but now have crazy headaches, and mild swelling of legs when sitting or standing to long, and appetite has decreased, but just had dosage changed so i think my body is just adjusting as far as swelling, appetite, and headaches are concerned.overall a great medication and have seen great improvements so far, but I will keep everyone updated.

column2: gray, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have not experienced any side effects with this medication. I had lost 20 lbs in 5 months, I gained back 11 lbs in 2 months after starting the treatment.

column2: marysuesmith, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: it has helped me with not losing more weight.

column2: tomleonard4, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with 2 nodules. Within 2 weeks of starting tapazole I was sleeping much better, had more energy during the day. By three months my TSH level was improved and I was moved up to 10 mg daily. It did show less side effects by splitting the dose half AM / half PM. Now a year later my TSH is very good and I am starting to wean off the medication .... I feel very good.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Well, the dosage I went from, 4 pills per day to two pills per day, to 1 pill per day, to now I'm taking 1/4 of a pill.  So far it' worked fined.  My unease has been the facct that I have to chop this little pill into fourths. but other than that it's worked great.

column2: pk, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: my daughter takes this. some strange side effects, though. swelling in her hands and eyes. i don't see that listed in the side effects, but the doctor said that edema is one of the sides effects. now i see some others that may explain some issues that she has. headaches, swollen lymph nodes, feeling like throwing up. we went to the emergency room for just those problems.

column2: sandy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
